extent: a crazy world we live in
Sentence: good morning. a crazy world we live in. the supreme court of the united states upheld the toughest three strikes law in the country yesterday. that 's california's. they rejected challenges to the law of sentences of 25 years to life without parole for a man convicted of stealing some golf clubs and 50 years for a man who stole some videotapes. the idea is if you have three felony convictions , you 're out of here. the voters overwhelmingly passed the law in 1994 to offset the liberal and lenient judges to let bad people off with nothing more than a slap of the wrist. they appealed to the supreme court on behalf of these two people. currently in california , 7000 people serving 25 to year life sentences under the three strikes law. one-third of them -- not that .
